What causes these error messages when running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution?
These error messages are caused by required dependencies for `./verusd` not being installed by default on the Linux distribution.

# error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory # error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory When running `./verusd` on a Linux distro (eg Debian or Devuan), not all dependencies may be installed by default, resulting in the errormessage `error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory` or `error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory`. To solve this you need to install the libgomp and zlib1g-dev libraries: `sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev` Solution supplied by: Oink.vrsc@ Note: revision date 2021-12-01.
./raw_txt_input/armfaq-01_libgomp.so.1.md

How can I solve the error messages "error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory" and "error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory" when running `./verusd` on a Linux distribution?
To solve these error messages, you need to install the `libgomp` and `zlib1g-dev` libraries using the command `sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev`.

# error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory # error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory When running `./verusd` on a Linux distro (eg Debian or Devuan), not all dependencies may be installed by default, resulting in the errormessage `error while loading shared libraries: libgomp.so.1: No such file or directory` or `error while loading shared libraries: libz.so: No such file or directory`. To solve this you need to install the libgomp and zlib1g-dev libraries: `sudo apt-get install libgomp1 zlib1g-dev` Solution supplied by: Oink.vrsc@ Note: revision date 2021-12-01.
